page.description: Covers component names, login properties, change password, lost info

important.p: The Login Component is not available in Alpha Anywhere Community Edition. Use the UX Component [SecurityFramework-LoginComponent] template instead.

deprecated.p: The Login Component is a legacy component. We strongly recommend using the UX Component instead to create a Login form. The [SecurityFramework-LoginComponent] UX template can be used as a replacement for the Login Component.

case.title: Component Name
case.description: The name of the stored component.

case.title: Layout Options > Show Options
case.description: Defines how to present the Change Password control. Options include:
"No Links"
"Show as Links"
"Show as Buttons"

case.title: Layout Options > Style Name
case.description: The Cascading Style Sheet applied to the Login dialog.

case.title: Messages > Login Information Missing
case.description: The message to show if some or all required login information is missing.

case.title: Messages > Login Failed
case.description: The message to show if a login fails.

case.title: Messages > User ID Required
case.description: The message to show if the user did not enter a User ID and selected to change his or her password.

case.title: Messages > User ID Validation Error Message
case.description: The message to display if the user ID does not match the validation requirements. This will override any message defined in the Security Settings dialog. Leave this message blank to use the message defined in the Security Settings dialog.

case.title: Messages > Password Validation Error Message
case.description: The message to display if the password does not match the validation requirements. This will override any message defined in the Security Settings dialog. Leave this message blank to use the message defined in the Security Settings dialog.

case.title: Messages > Password Expired
case.description: The message to display if the user's password has expired.

case.title: Messages > Locked Out - Exceeded Allowed Attempts
case.description: The message to display if the user is locked out because of too many failed login attempts. This will override any message defined in the Security Settings dialog. Leave this message blank to use the message defined in the Security Settings dialog.

case.title: Messages > Undefined Error
case.description: The message to display if any undefined error occurs.

case.title: Messages > Password Changed Succeeded
case.description: The message to display when a password changed request succeeds.

case.title: Layout Options > Style Name
case.description: The Cascading Style Sheet applied to the Change Password dialog.

case.title: Messages > Password Change Failed
case.description: The message to display when a password changed request fails.

case.title: Messages > Password Restrict Reuse
case.description: The message to display when the entered password cannot be used because it is in the restricted list.

case.title: Layout Options > Style Name
case.description: The Cascading Style Sheet applied to the Lost Password dialog.

case.title: Messages > Email Validation Error Message
case.description: The message to show a user if the email value is not a valid email address.

case.title: Message > Required Values Missing
case.description: The message to show a user if a required value is missing.

case.title: Message > Single Use Password Notice
case.description: The message to show a user if this is a single use password.

case.title: Message > Request Failed
case.description: The message to show a user if a password request failed for any reason.

case.title: Message > Display User Id Title
case.description: The title to show before the User ID if a lost User ID is shown on the screen.

case.title: Message > Display Password Title
case.description: The title to show before the Password if a lost password is shown on the screen.
